Event.name: Cycle count
Event.Description: Counts the number of clock cycles. Every clock cycle increments the counter

Event.name: L1 I-Cache read miss
Event.Description: Counts the number of instruction-cache read misses

Event.name: L1 D-Cache read miss
Event.Description: Counts the number of data-cache read misses (including non-cacheable and non-bufferable cache accesses)

Event.name: L1 D-Cache write miss
Event.Description: Counts the number of data-cache write misses (including non-cacheable and non-bufferable misses)

Event.name: I-TLB miss
Event.Description: Counts the number of instruction TLB misses

Event.name: Single issue
Event.Description: Counts the number of cycles the processor single-issues instructions

Event.name: Branch retired
Event.Description: Counts the number of times one branch retires

Event.name: ROB full
Event.Description: Counts the number of cycles the ROB is full

Event.name: MMU read beat
Event.Description: Counts the number of times the bus returns RDY to the MMU, useful when determining bus efficiency. A user can use the signal that the MMU is requesting the bus and how long it takes on average for the data to return. (mmu_bus_req / mmu_read_count)

Event.name: L1 I-Cache read beat
Event.Description: Counts the number of times the bus returns RDY to the instruction cache, useful to determine the cache’s average read latency (also known as read miss or read count)

Event.name: Hold issue stage
Event.Description: Count the number of cycles the instruction issue is stalled

Event.name: Write buffer write beat
Event.Description: Counts the number times the bus returns RDY to the write buffer, useful to determine the write buffer’s average write latency (WB Write Latency/WB Write Beat)

Event.name: WMMX2 store FIFO full
Event.Description: Counts the number of cycles the SIMD coprocessor store FIFO is full

Event.name: L2-Cache latency
Event.Description: The latency for the most recent L2C read from the external bus
